revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of July 18th, 1860, at Rivabellosa, Near Miranda de Ebro, in Spain
tldr: The author describes his observations and photographic experiments during the total solar eclipse of July 18th, 1860, at Rivabellosa, Spain, using the Kew photo-heliograph and other photographic equipment. He discusses the challenges faced and the results obtained, including the importance of celestial photography for understanding the nature of solar phenomena.
